page.title: 08Playground Games - Specific.
page.content:
Outlined below are detailed descriptions of two playground games played by the children of Glanaman.
{A. BRITISH BULLDOGS.} Players stand in a line. One person is chosen as 'it' and stands in front of the others. This person says, "British Bulldogs 1 2 3," and all the players have to run past him or her to another point. Anyone caught becomes 'it.' {B. I SENT A LETTER TO MY FRIEND AND ON { THE WAY I LOST IT.} Players sit in a circle. The person who is 'it' picks up a 'letter' and runs around the circle, dropping the letter behind a player. When the letter is discovered the player has to get up and chase the peson who is 'it.' If 'it' is caught he has to sit in the circle, sucking his thumb.
